name: blubbery
content:
blubbery adjective
(FAT)
Add to word list
Add to word list
fat or thick like the blubber of a whale: Researchers saw a good opportunity to study the rare whale when the blubbery carcass washed ashore. His pale, blubbery arms were covered in tattoos. Related word
blubber noun
More examplesFewer examplesWe saw seals basking on the ice in all their blubbery glory.I am afraid we are turning into a nation of blubbery, inert slobs.

Animal physiology: fat or well-built
blubbery adjective
(CRYING)
crying a lot in a noisy way, like a child: I get too emotional at weddings; they make me a blubbery mess. Her guilty pleasure is watching spoiled celebrities argue and get blubbery on reality TV. Related word
blubber verb informal disapproving
More examplesFewer examplesThe music is intensely emotional, but never turns blubbery or self-indulgent.
